title: The Mukaab
description: The Mukaab. What is it? Why is it a thing? Who can pay for it? This article explores the economic and ethical benefits and drawbacks of this mysterious cube.

title: China Africa
description:
China has been the largest equity
investor into Africa since 2013.
This is motivated by an abundance
of natural resources, growing
industry, a 30,500km coastline and
rich agriculture with only 25% of
arable land cultivated.

title: Marx Engels
description:
Marx argued that workers create
value through their work, yet are
not compensated properly. The
labour is exploited by the ruling
class, the bourgeoisie, who
generate profits by selling the
products at a higher price than
what is given to the workers in
return for their labour.

title: Sweden Thriving
description:
Sweden has been most renowned
for being one of the leading
economies globally in terms of
sustainability. This could be
illustrated through Sweden’s
rankings in indexes that measures
economic sustainability.

title: Graphics Cards
description:
am confident that the majority of
us have smartphones, tablets or
computers and use them on a
daily basis. Scrolling through
social media feed, searching
information online, playing video
games et cetera.

title: Wall Street Germany
description:
The Wall Street crash of 1929,
also known as Black Tuesday, was
a catastrophic event in the history
of the global economy. The Great
Depression was brought about by
the collapse US stock market,
which had far-reaching effects.

title: Impact of Brexit
description:
The United Kingdom's decision to
leave the European Union,
popularly known as Brexit, was a
significant moment in European
politics.

title: Japanese Deflation
description:
Sweden has been most renowned
for being one of the leading
economies globally in terms of
sustainability. This could be
illustrated through Sweden’s
rankings in indexes that measures
economic sustainability.

title: Protect Nature
description:
In this article I outline my policies
that I believe will aid governments
around the world in protecting and
restoring natural environments.

title: Robot Wages
description:
Today we see that robots are the
product of the economic
evolution towards the automative
industry, in particular automation
capital.

title: Russian Collapse
description:
The widespread economic
sanctions imposed on Russia, a
state who have struggled to
diversify from ‘conservative and
tight’ economic philosophy
preferred by their finance
ministers, are likely to completely
cripple the Russian economy.

title: Financial Crisis
description:
The financial crisis refers to a
period of economic turmoil
characterised by a sharp
decline in asset prices, a
contraction of credit markets,
and a widespread increase in
bankruptcies and defaults.

title: SVB Collapse
description:
On the 10th March, Silicon Valley
Bank collapsed only 48 hours after
a statement released which
sought to raise US$2.5 billion to
repair a hole in its balance sheet.

title: UBS Credit Suisse
description:
On the weekend beginning 18th
March, authorities in Switzerland
prepared emergency measures to
fast-track a takeover of Credit
Suisse by UBS.

title: Economics of Wellbeing
description:
“Since the beginning of this
decade, global output has grown
by over 3 percent annually and
inflation has slowed down in
virtually all regions of the world.

title: Economics of Vaping
description:
There are many costs to an
economy if it has a sustained
difference in inequality, and we
can usually find some of these
traits in countries with high Gini
Index.

title: Demise of Hong Kong
description:
Due to the pandemic, Hong Kong
was experiencing slow economic
growth because of weakened
domestic demand.

title: Brain Drain India
description:
A ‘brain drain’ occurs when an
economy loses its most highly
skilled and competent individuals
in the labour force to other
countries, perhaps due to political
turmoil present within a nation or
more favourable economic
opportunities elsewhere.

title: Ancient Greece
description: The Ancient Greeks had their own currency called the drachma with an Athenian monetary system set up.
